articles.content:
Floral baskets to Kim Jong Il from Japanese personages 
    Pyongyang, February 12 (KCNA) -- Representative of the Ehime, Japan, Institute for Modern Korean Studies Takashi Nada, president of the Ichihara Society for Korean Studies in Chiba Prefecture, Japan, Koske Tokida and representative of the Japan "Love and Peace" Fusatoshi Fujisawa sent floral baskets to Kim Jong Il on Feb. 11 on the occasion of his birthday.
 Letters "Best Wishes for Food Health of His Excellency Great General Secretary Kim Jong Il" are written on the ribbons hanging on the floral baskets.
